title: Unit 3 Sec 7: Genitourinary & Skin
description: Tests understanding of kidney function/failure and burn management formulas.

questions.question: Using the **Parkland Formula** (4ml x kg x %Burn), calculate the total fluid requirement for the first 24 hours for a 60kg patient with 50% burns.
questions.hint: Multiply 4 by the weight by the percentage.

questions.question: Which phase of Acute Renal Failure is characterized by urine output less than 400ml/day?
questions.explanation: Oliguria is clinically defined as urine output < 400ml/day.

questions.question: The functional unit of the kidney is the ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: The nephron is the microscopic structural and functional unit of the kidney.

questions.question: Match the skin disorder to its description:
questions.explanation: Psoriasis is autoimmune; Tinea is fungal; Scabies is parasitic; Urticaria is allergic.

questions.question: Which is the most common sign of Bladder Cancer?
questions.explanation: Painless blood in the urine (haematuria) is the hallmark sign of bladder cancer.
